title: Andy Murray's comeback continues apace as he defeats Cameron Norrie to book place in quarter-finals of China Open
text:
Andy Murray scored another encouraging victory in Beijing on Wednesday. His 7-6, 6-7, 6-1 win over fellow Briton Cameron Norrie carried him into his first ATP quarter-final of the year, while also earning him a valuable day off to rest a weary body.

As far as Murray’s ball-striking is concerned, there was plenty to admire – particularly when he came forward to finish points at the net. But putting matches back-to-back remains new territory, at least since he underwent the insertion of a metal hip joint in January. This match came only 24 hours after his demanding 7-6, 7-6 victory over world No 8 Matteo Berrettini, and there were moments when he looked completely puffed.

“I tried to shorten the points a lot at the end of the second set and in the third set,” Murray admitted in his on-court interview. “Because when we were playing the long rallies, he was getting the better of them and making me run a lot. I was getting tired so I had to change the way the match was going and managed to shorten enough points at the end.”
description: Andy Murray scored another encouraging victory in Beijing on Wednesday.
